GPREGRET.description: General purpose retention register. This register is a retained register.

RESET.description: Pin reset functionality configuration register. This register is a retained register.

OFF.description: Reset from wake-up from OFF mode detected by the use of DETECT signal from GPIO.

LPCOMP.description: Reset from wake-up from OFF mode detected by the use of ANADETECT signal from LPCOMP.

DIF.description: Reset from wake-up from OFF mode detected by entering into debug interface mode.

ONRAM0.description: RAM block 0 behaviour in ON mode.

ONRAM1.description: RAM block 1 behaviour in ON mode.

OFFRAM0.description: RAM block 0 behaviour in OFF mode.

OFFRAM1.description: RAM block 1 behaviour in OFF mode.

RESET.description: Enable or disable pin reset in debug interface mode.

ONRAM2.description: RAM block 2 behaviour in ON mode.

ONRAM3.description: RAM block 3 behaviour in ON mode.

OFFRAM2.description: RAM block 2 behaviour in OFF mode.

OFFRAM3.description: RAM block 3 behaviour in OFF mode.

TASKS_CAL.description: Start calibration of LFCLK RC oscillator.

EVENTS_DONE.description: Calibration of LFCLK RC oscillator completed.

LFCLKSRCCOPY.description: Clock source for the LFCLK clock, set when task LKCLKSTART is triggered.

LFCLKSRC.description: Clock source for the LFCLK clock.

SRC.description: Active clock source for the HF clock.
Active clock source for the LF clock.
Clock source for the LFCLK clock, set when task LKCLKSTART is triggered.

PERR0.description: Configuration of peripherals in mpu regions.

PROTENSET0.description: Erase and write protection bit enable set register.

PROTENSET1.description: Erase and write protection bit enable set register.

DISABLEINDEBUG.description: Disable erase and write protection mechanism in debug mode.

PROTBLOCKSIZE.description: Erase and write protection block size.

DISABLEINDEBUG.description: Disable protection mechanism in debug mode.

PROTBLOCKSIZE.description: Erase and write protection block size.

TASKS_RSSISTART.description: Start the RSSI and take one sample of the receive signal strength.

EVENTS_DEVMATCH.description: A device address match occurred on the last received packet.

EVENTS_DEVMISS.description: No device address match occurred on the last received packet.

EVENTS_RSSIEND.description: Sampling of the receive signal strength complete. A new RSSI sample is ready for readout at the RSSISAMPLE register.

EVENTS_BCMATCH.description: Bit counter reached bit count value specified in BCC register.

PACKETPTR.description: Packet pointer. Decision point: START task.

BASE0.description: Radio base address 0. Decision point: START task.

BASE1.description: Radio base address 1. Decision point: START task.

PREFIX0.description: Prefixes bytes for logical addresses 0 to 3.

PREFIX1.description: Prefixes bytes for logical addresses 4 to 7.

READY_START.description: Shortcut between READY event and START task.

END_DISABLE.description: Shortcut between END event and DISABLE task.

DISABLED_TXEN.description: Shortcut between DISABLED event and TXEN task.

DISABLED_RXEN.description: Shortcut between DISABLED event and RXEN task.

ADDRESS_RSSISTART.description: Shortcut between ADDRESS event and RSSISTART task.

END_START.description: Shortcut between END event and START task.

ADDRESS_BCSTART.description: Shortcut between ADDRESS event and BCSTART task.

DISABLED_RSSISTOP.description: Shortcut between DISABLED event and RSSISTOP task.

RXMATCH.description: Logical address in which previous packet was received.

RXCRC.description: CRC field of previously received packet.

DAI.description: Index (n) of device address (see DAB[n] and DAP[n]) that obtained an address match.

FREQUENCY.description: Radio channel frequency offset in MHz: RF Frequency = 2400 + FREQUENCY (MHz). Decision point: TXEN or RXEN task.

TXPOWER.description: Radio output power. Decision point: TXEN task.

MODE.description: Radio data rate and modulation setting. Decision point: TXEN or RXEN task.

LFLEN.description: Length of length field in number of bits. Decision point: START task.

S0LEN.description: Length of S0 field in number of bytes. Decision point: START task.

S1LEN.description: Length of S1 field in number of bits. Decision point: START task.

MAXLEN.description: Maximum length of packet payload in number of bytes.

STATLEN.description: Static length in number of bytes. Decision point: START task.

BALEN.description: Base address length in number of bytes. Decision point: START task.

ENDIAN.description: On air endianness of packet length field. Decision point: START task.

AP0.description: Address prefix 0. Decision point: START task.

AP1.description: Address prefix 1. Decision point: START task.

AP2.description: Address prefix 2. Decision point: START task.

AP3.description: Address prefix 3. Decision point: START task.

AP4.description: Address prefix 4. Decision point: START task.

AP5.description: Address prefix 5. Decision point: START task.

AP6.description: Address prefix 6. Decision point: START task.

AP7.description: Address prefix 7. Decision point: START task.

TXADDRESS.description: Logical address to be used when transmitting a packet. Decision point: START task.

ADDR0.description: Enable reception on logical address 0. Decision point: START task.

ADDR1.description: Enable reception on logical address 1. Decision point: START task.

ADDR2.description: Enable reception on logical address 2. Decision point: START task.

ADDR3.description: Enable reception on logical address 3. Decision point: START task.

ADDR4.description: Enable reception on logical address 4. Decision point: START task.

ADDR5.description: Enable reception on logical address 5. Decision point: START task.

ADDR6.description: Enable reception on logical address 6. Decision point: START task.

ADDR7.description: Enable reception on logical address 7. Decision point: START task.

LEN.description: CRC length. Decision point: START task.

SKIPADDR.description: Leave packet address field out of the CRC calculation. Decision point: START task.

CRCPOLY.description: CRC polynomial. Decision point: START task.

CRCINIT.description: Initial value for CRC calculation. Decision point: START task.

CONSTCARRIER.description: Constant carrier. Decision point: TXEN task.

PLLLOCK.description: PLL lock. Decision point: TXEN or RXEN task.

TIFS.description: Inter frame spacing in microseconds. Decision point: START rask

RSSISAMPLE.description: RSSI sample result. The result is read as a positive value so that ReceivedSignalStrength = -RSSISAMPLE dBm

DATAWHITEIV.description: Data whitening initial value. Bit 0 corresponds to Position 0 of the LSFR, Bit 1 to position 5... Decision point: TXEN or RXEN task.

ENA0.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 0.

ENA1.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 1.

ENA2.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 2.

ENA3.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 3.

ENA4.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 4.

ENA5.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 5.

ENA6.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 6.

ENA7.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 7.

ENABLE.description: Enable or disable override of default trim values.

ERRORSRC.description: Error source. Write error field to 1 to clear error.

RXD.description: RXD register. On read action the buffer pointer is displaced. Once read the character is consumed. If read when no character available, the UART will stop working.

CONFIG.description: Configuration of parity and hardware flow control register.

CTS_STARTRX.description: Shortcut between CTS event and STARTRX task.

NCTS_STOPRX.description: Shortcut between NCTS event and STOPRX task.

OVERRUN.description: A start bit is received while the previous data still lies in RXD. (Data loss).

PARITY.description: A character with bad parity is received. Only checked if HW parity control is enabled.

FRAMING.description: A valid stop bit is not detected on the serial data input after all bits in a character have been received.

BREAK.description: The serial data input is '0' for longer than the length of a data frame.

ENABLE.description: Enable or disable UART and acquire IOs.

RXD.description: RX data from previous transfer. Double buffered.

EVENTS_READY.description: TXD byte sent and RXD byte received.

EVENTS_RXDREADY.description: Two-wire ready to deliver new RXD byte received.

EVENTS_TXDSENT.description: Two-wire finished sending last TXD byte.

ERRORSRC.description: Two-wire error source. Write error field to 1 to clear error.

ADDRESS.description: Address used in the two-wire transfer.

BB_SUSPEND.description: Shortcut between BB event and the SUSPEND task.

BB_STOP.description: Shortcut between BB event and the STOP task.

OVERRUN.description: Byte received in RXD register before read of the last received byte (data loss).

ANACK.description: NACK received after sending the address.

DNACK.description: NACK received after sending a data byte.

POLARITY.description: Effects on output when in Task mode, or events on input that generates an event.

OUTINIT.description: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured as a Task.

TASKS_CAPTURE[%s].description: Capture Timer value to CC[n] registers.

PRESCALER.description: 4-bit prescaler to source clock frequency (max value 9). Source clock frequency is divided by 2^SCALE.

COMPARE0_CLEAR.description: Shortcut between CC[0] event and the CLEAR task.

COMPARE1_CLEAR.description: Shortcut between CC[1] event and the CLEAR task.

COMPARE2_CLEAR.description: Shortcut between CC[2] event and the CLEAR task.

COMPARE3_CLEAR.description: Shortcut between CC[3] event and the CLEAR task.

COMPARE0_STOP.description: Shortcut between CC[0] event and the STOP task.

COMPARE1_STOP.description: Shortcut between CC[1] event and the STOP task.

COMPARE2_STOP.description: Shortcut between CC[2] event and the STOP task.

COMPARE3_STOP.description: Shortcut between CC[3] event and the STOP task.

BITMODE.description: Sets timer behaviour ro be like the implementation of a timer with width as indicated.

PRESCALER.description: Timer PRESCALER value. Max value is 9.

EVTEN.description: Configures event enable routing to PPI for each RTC event.

EVTENSET.description: Enable events routing to PPI. The reading of this register gives the value of EVTEN.

EVTENCLR.description: Disable events routing to PPI. The reading of this register gives the value of EVTEN.

PRESCALER.description: 12-bit prescaler for COUNTER frequency (32768/(PRESCALER+1)). Must be written when RTC is STOPed.

TICK.description: Enable routing to PPI of TICK event.

OVRFLW.description: Enable routing to PPI of OVRFLW event.

COMPARE0.description: Enable routing to PPI of COMPARE[0] event.

COMPARE1.description: Enable routing to PPI of COMPARE[1] event.

COMPARE2.description: Enable routing to PPI of COMPARE[2] event.

COMPARE3.description: Enable routing to PPI of COMPARE[3] event.

TICK.description: Disable routing to PPI of TICK event.

OVRFLW.description: Disable routing to PPI of OVRFLW event.

COMPARE0.description: Disable routing to PPI of COMPARE[0] event.

COMPARE1.description: Disable routing to PPI of COMPARE[1] event.

COMPARE2.description: Disable routing to PPI of COMPARE[2] event.

COMPARE3.description: Disable routing to PPI of COMPARE[3] event.

EVENTS_DATARDY.description: Temperature measurement complete, data ready event.

TEMP.description: Die temperature in degC, 2's complement format, 0.25 degC pecision.

EVENTS_VALRDY.description: New random number generated and written to VALUE register.

VALRDY_STOP.description: Shortcut between VALRDY event and STOP task.

TASKS_STARTECB.description: Start ECB block encrypt. If a crypto operation is running, this will not initiate a new encryption and the ERRORECB event will be triggered.

TASKS_STOPECB.description: Stop current ECB encryption. If a crypto operation is running, this will will trigger the ERRORECB event.

EVENTS_ERRORECB.description: ECB block encrypt aborted due to a STOPECB task or due to an error.

TASKS_START.description: Start resolving addresses based on IRKs specified in the IRK data structure.

NIRK.description: Number of Identity root Keys in the IRK data structure.

IRKPTR.description: Pointer to the IRK data structure.

ADDRPTR.description: Pointer to the resolvable address (6 bytes).

SCRATCHPTR.description: Pointer to a scratch data area used for temporary storage during resolution. A minimum of 3 bytes must be reserved.

STATUS.description: The IRK used last time an address was resolved.

NIRK.description: Number of Identity root Keys in the IRK data structure.

TASKS_KSGEN.description: Start generation of key-stream. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

TASKS_CRYPT.description: Start encrypt/decrypt. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

CNFPTR.description: Pointer to a data structure holding AES key and NONCE vector.

SCRATCHPTR.description: Pointer to a scratch data area used for temporary storage during resolution. A minimum of 43 bytes must be reserved.

ENDKSGEN_CRYPT.description: Shortcut between ENDKSGEN event and CRYPT task.

MICSTATUS.description: Result of the MIC check performed during the previous CCM RX STARTCRYPT

CRV.description: Counter reload value in number of 32kiHz clock cycles.

SLEEP.description: Configure the watchdog to pause or not while the CPU is sleeping.

HALT.description: Configure the watchdog to pause or not while the CPU is halted by the debugger.

TASKS_READCLRACC.description: Transfers the content from ACC registers to ACCREAD registers, and clears the ACC registers.

EVENTS_SAMPLERDY.description: A new sample is written to the sample register.

EVENTS_REPORTRDY.description: REPORTPER number of samples accumulated in ACC register, and ACC register different than zero.

REPORTPER.description: Number of samples to generate an EVENT_REPORTRDY.

ACCREAD.description: Snapshot of ACC register. Value generated by the TASKS_READCLEACC task.

PSELA.description: Pin select for phase A input.

PSELB.description: Pin select for phase B input.

LEDPRE.description: Time LED is switched ON before the sample.

ACCDBLREAD.description: Snapshot of ACCDBL register. Value generated by the TASKS_READCLEACC task.

REPORTRDY_READCLRACC.description: Shortcut between REPORTRDY event and READCLRACC task.

SAMPLERDY_STOP.description: Shortcut between SAMPLERDY event and STOP task.

SAMPLE.description: Last sample taken in compliment to 2.

REPORTPER.description: Number of samples to generate an EVENT_REPORTRDY.

LEDPRE.description: Period in us the LED in switched on prior to sampling.

EVENTS_READY.description: LPCOMP is ready and output is valid.

EVENTS_DOWN.description: Input voltage crossed the threshold going down.

EVENTS_UP.description: Input voltage crossed the threshold going up.

EVENTS_CROSS.description: Input voltage crossed the threshold in any direction.

READY_SAMPLE.description: Shortcut between READY event and SAMPLE task.

READY_STOP.description: Shortcut between RADY event and STOP task.

DOWN_STOP.description: Shortcut between DOWN event and STOP task.

UP_STOP.description: Shortcut between UP event and STOP task.

CROSS_STOP.description: Shortcut between CROSS event and STOP task.

RESULT.description: Result of last compare. Decision point SAMPLE task.

ERASEPAGE.description: Register for erasing a non-protected non-volatile memory page.

ERASEPCR1.description: Register for erasing a non-protected non-volatile memory page.

ERASEALL.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory.

ERASEPCR0.description: Register for erasing a protected non-volatile memory page.

ERASEUICR.description: Register for start erasing User Information Congfiguration Registers.

ERASEALL.description: Starts the erasing of all user NVM (code region 0/1 and UICR registers).

ERASEUICR.description: It can only be used when all contents of code region 1 are erased.

CODEPAGESIZE.description: Code memory page size in bytes.

CLENR0.description: Length of code region 0 in bytes.

NUMRAMBLOCK.description: Number of individualy controllable RAM blocks.

SIZERAMBLOCKS.description: Size of RAM blocks in bytes.

SIZERAMBLOCK[%s].description: Deprecated array of size of RAM block in bytes. This name is kept for backward compatinility purposes. Use SIZERAMBLOCKS instead.

NRF_1MBIT[%s].description: Override values for the OVERRIDEn registers in RADIO for NRF_1Mbit mode.

BLE_1MBIT[%s].description: Override values for the OVERRIDEn registers in RADIO for BLE_1Mbit mode.

FWID.description: Firmware Identification Number pre-loaded into the flash.

NRF_1MBIT.description: Override default values for NRF_1Mbit mode.

BLE_1MBIT.description: Override default values for BLE_1Mbit mode.

XTALFREQ.description: Reset value for CLOCK XTALFREQ register.

PR0.description: Readback protect region 0. Will be ignored if pre-programmed factory code is present on the chip.

PALL.description: Readback protect all code in the device.

XTALFREQ.description: Reset value for CLOCK XTALFREQ register.

FWID.description: Identification number for the firmware loaded into the chip.
